results.title: Garin Nugroho: my family, my film and my nation
results.creator_credit: Garin Nugroho and S E T Film Workshop
results.brief_description: Garin Nugroho narrates this collage of his own documentaries and films. He talks about the films and how he associates them with his personal life. There are clips from his feature ‘Letter for an Angel’ and documentaries ‘Water and Romi’ and ‘Tale of a Mousedeer’ which inspired the feature ‘Leaf on a Pillow’. Nugroho also articulates his concerns for the failing condition of his country. In Bahasa Indonesia with English subtitles.

results.title: Gargoyles
results.brief_description: Gargoyles is an American cartoon series produced by Disney Television Animation and Buena Vista Television that features Shakespearean themes.

constellations_other.name: Sweet Country
constellations_other.description: Warwick Thornton’s feature film Sweet Country is based on the story of Wilaberta Jack, which was told to sound recordist David Tranter by his grandfather and translated into storyboards.

results.description:
Gargoyles is an American cartoon series produced by Disney Television Animation and Buena Vista Television, and originally aired from October 24, 1994 to February 15, 1997. The series is credited for its relatively dark tone, complex story arcs, and melodrama; character arcs were heavily employed throughout the series, as were Shakespearean themes.

A Gargoyles video game adaptation and a spin-off comic series were also created in 1995. The show’s storyline continued from 2006–2009 in a comic book series of the same name, written by Greg Weisman and produced by Slave Labor Graphics.
description_for_label:

The series is credited for its relatively dark tone, complex story arcs, and melodrama; character arcs were heavily employed throughout the series, as were Shakespearean themes.

A Gargoyles video game adaptation and a spin-off comic series were also created in 1995. The show’s storyline continued from 2006–2009 in a comic book series of the same name, written by Greg Weisman and produced by Slave Labor Graphics.

results.title: Gardens of the Caribbean
results.creator_credit: Emma Halit, Carole Mattison, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: The climate of the Caribbean fosters exuberantly coloured gardens. In this documentary Anne Swithinbank visits some of the wonderful sights in the area including; swamps and rain forests in Trinidad, Grenada and Golden Eye in Jamaica, Balata Gardens in Martinique, Andromeda Gardens in Barbados, vegetable plots in Jamaica and a squatter’s garden in Trinidad. Join Anne for an armchair guide of the fabulous Caribbean.

results.title: Gardens of stone
results.creator_credit: Francis Ford Coppola, Michael I. Levy and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: There’s the war-toughened sergeant who passionately longs to train soldiers for fighting in Vietnam, but is assigned to the elite Old Guard. His beautiful girlfriend, a Washington Post reporter who is fervently against the war. The zealous soldier that the sergeant takes under his wing, and the young woman who learns the pain of being an army wife. Their stories are poignantly told in Francis Coppola’s perceptive and moving film that stars James Caan, Angelica Huston, James Earl Jones and Mary Stuart Masterson. This film takes a different look at the Vietnam war era in the United States. It is a drama that captures the anguishing effect of the war on the relationships of the men and women at home. Based on the novel by Nicholas Proffitt. Original music by Carmine Coppola.

results.title: Gardens of South Africa
results.creator_credit: Gary Johnston, Royal Horticultural Society (Great Britain) and Two Four Productions
results.brief_description: South Africa has an abundance of beautiful gardens and this video provides the viewer with an overview of some of them. Sites visited include; the Modjadji Cycad Forest, Garden Route, Cape Point, the Botanic Gardens at Kirstenbosch and a trip to Brenthurst. From viewing these gardens you can identify many familiar garden plants, only this time they’re found in their country of origin.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.brief_description: Some of the scenic beauty of Japan - in nature and in the highly cultivated and famous gardens in Tokyo and Kyoto; a variety of gardens which have been planned and cultivated to please both the mind and the eye, including those using sand and stone to represent natural landscapes and which have symbolic signifance. A short sequence shows the traditional tea ceremony. A revised version of Title Codes 004193 and 004194.

results.title: Gardens of Japan
results.creator_credit: Seiji Koga, Japan. Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Koga Productions
results.brief_description: Generations of culture in Japan are shown in gardens existing for hundreds of years; varying in form and expression reflecting the influence of the period in which each was built. A temple garden with thick moss and symbolic arrangement of stones; dry landscaping; extravagant and imposing gardens with beautiful lakes reflecting the mountains beyond; peaceful and harmonious settings for the buildings which were set in them.
